title: Little-Seen Meltdowns in Leveraged Loans
text: The leveraged loan market saw more deals tighten than widen pricing for the first time in a month this week as higher-quality credits continued to receive a positive reaction. Bloomberg's Caroline Hyde sat down with Blackrock's Bob Miller, Invesco's Krishna Memani and James Athey of Aberdeen Standard Investments to discuss the outlook for credit markets.

title: What Does The Latest Bitcoin ETF Rejection Mean For The Future?
text: While the ETF market has been anxiously awaiting a Bitcoin ETF, the SEC recently rejected Bitwise’s ETF proposal. Now crypto investors are wondering what this means for the future of potential crypto ETFs and the market as a whole.

title: An ETF Strategy to Smooth Out the Volatility in Small-Cap Exposure
text: Small-capitalization stocks have been a good source of returns over the years, but the outperformance has come with its fair share of volatility. Exchange traded fund investors, though, can look to an options-based small-cap strategy to mitigate some of the more extreme market moves.

title: Morningstar Report Shows Increase In Bond ETF Inflows, Move Toward Passive Funds
text: The latest report from Morningstar shows that mixed market volatility in September sent investors running into bonds for safety, and looking more towards passively managed funds. The weakening economic data that has been released, along with Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts, have provided the adequate fuel for bond-fund returns in the form of falling bond yields.

title: US imposes record $7.5 billion in tariffs on European goods

title: US Stocks Decline Friday
text: U.S. stocks were in the red on Friday on the back of poor growth in China. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 0.95% to 26,770, the S&P 500 index declined 0.39% to 2,986 and the Nasdaq Composite Index slid 0.83% to 8,089.

title: US Indexes Close Lower Friday After Weak China Data Report

title: Investors' Short Interest Tumbles as Stocks Near Record Highs
